zone.line: nation all memories of heroism and
virtue. Yet this was very unlike my
early life although as then I was
confined to Nature and books. Then I
bounded across the fields; my spirit
often seemed to ride upon the winds, and
to mingle in joyful sympathy with
the ambient air. Then if I wandered
slowly I cheered myself with a sweet
song or sweeter day dreams: I felt a
holy rapture spring from all I saw.
I drank in joy with life; my steps were
light; my eyes, clear from the love
that animated them, sought the hea
vens, and with my long hair loosened
to the winds I gave my body and
my mind to sympathy and delight.
But now my walk was slow – My eyes
were seldom raised and often filled
with tears; no song; no smiles; no careless
motion that might bespeak a mind
intent on what surrounded it – I was
gathered up into myself – a selfish
